definition: low/beneath/to lower (one's head)/to let droop/to hang down/to incline
breath/news/interest (on an investment or loan)/to cease/to stop/to rest/Taiwan pr. [xi2]

sentences.english: The Federal Reserve should instead reverse its low-interest-rate policy before it increases the level of discoordination in the economy.
sentences.chinese: 聯儲應當在低息政策導致經濟失調增加前改變該政策。

sentences.english: Some received substantial occupational assistance in the form of low-interest loans.
sentences.chinese: 一些人得到了大量的低息貸款形式的職業援助。

sentences.english: The company boondoggled investors into a low-interest project.
sentences.chinese: 這家公司誆騙投資者向一項低息工程投資。

sentences.english: She is using low-interest micro-loans from an organization in her village.
sentences.chinese: 她從自己家鄉的一個機構貸到了低息的小額貸款。

sentences.english: China is trying to sweeten its bid by offering low-interest financing.
sentences.chinese: 而中國正試圖提供低息的融資來擊退對手。

sentences.english: These days 60 percent of all aid comes in the form of low-interest loans.
sentences.chinese: 現在有60%的資助項目是以低息貸款形式提供的。

sentences.english: He is eligible for a low-interest government loan of up to $30m.
sentences.chinese: 他可以從政府那裏申請到最多3千萬美元的低息貸款。

sentences.english: The combination of low interest rates and low prices made people more willing to buy on the private market.
sentences.chinese: 低息加上低樓價可提升買樓意欲，刺激私人樓宇市場。

sentences.english: The availability of cheap long term credit would help small businesses.
sentences.chinese: 低息長期貸款可以扶持小型企業。

sentences.english: Thestate whaling company is kept afloat with cheap loans and subsidies.
sentences.chinese: 國有捕鯨公司的存在也仰賴於低息貸款和補貼。

sentences.english: With supply soaring, only cheap money kept the game going.
sentences.chinese: 隨着供給量的飆升，只有低息貸款纔可以讓遊戲繼續。

definition: a loan/CL:筆|笔[bi3]/to provide a loan (e.g. bank)/to raise a loan (from e.g. a bank)
to borrow or lend money/debit and credit items on a balance sheet
a mortgage (loanword via Cantonese)/to buy property on a mortgage
certificate of deposit/time deposit/abbr. for 定期存款|定期存款[ding4 qi1 cun2 kuan3]
to lend money (as a commercial loan)
